DOC.brief_summary: The overall aim project elucidate primary bio-psycho-social ( BPS ) risk factor albuminuria youth type 2 diabetes ( T2D ) mechanism cause renal injury . The Study Aims include : 1 . Characterize primary BPS risk factor associate prevalent progressive albuminuria youth T2D . 2 . Determine individual , family community level factor influence biological psychological risk factor behavior ( adherence ) could modify protect prevalent progressive albuminuria . 3 . Determine systemic renal inflammation common pathway BPS risk factor lead albuminuria youth T2D . Study Hypotheses include : 1 . Biological factor ( poor glycemic control systolic ambulatory hypertension ) , psychological social adversity ( stress , mental distress poverty ) significant predictor prevalent progressive albuminuria youth T2D . 2 . Community family support negatively associate stress , low risk prevalent progressive albuminuria . 3 . Systemic renal inflammation common pathway BPS risk factor lead albuminuria youth T2D .
DOC.brief_title: Improving Renal Complications Adolescents With Type 2 Diabetes Through REsearch Cohort Study ( National iCARE Study )
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator conduct case-control study within two-year , prospective observational cohort study 400 prevalent case T2D diagnose < 18 year age . The investigator evaluate primary BPS risk factor associate prevalent albuminuria use principal component analysis ( PCA ) association primary exposure variable enrollment . After confirm relevant BPS factor PCA analysis , investigator utilize structural equation model approach confirm develop model .
DOC.criteria: All youth T2D meet exclusion criterion eligible study . Criteria Diagnosis T2D : 1 . Diagnosis diabetes make accord Canadian Diabetes Association criterion . There must 2 abnormal blood glucose test different day OR 1 abnormal blood glucose test + symptom diabetes : Fasting plasma glucose > 7.0 mmol/L Random glucose > 11.1mmol/L 2 hour glucose > 11.1 mmol/L standard oral glucose tolerance test ( 75g ) . 2 . Distinguishing T2D type 1 diabetes ( T1D ) base clinical risk factor include : Presence overweight/obesity , Other evidence insulin resistance ( acanthosis nigricans ) Family history type 2 diabetes ( 1st degree relative ) Intrauterine exposure hyperglycemia , Family heritage highrisk ethnic group ( Indigenous , Hispanic , South Asian , Asian African descent ) Absence diabetes associate autoantibody HNF1 alpha heterozygote homozygote 1 . Diabetes secondary medication use surgery 2 . Antibodies suggestive type 1 diabetes 3 . Current treatment oral steroid immunosuppressive agent may interfere cortisol assessment inflammatory marker 4 . Ever cancer 5 . Other chronic illness associate systemic inflammation ( ex . Juvenile rheumatoid arthritis , Crohns disease ) 6 . Patient caregiver unable unwilling provide voluntary inform assent/consent
